   17: -module(merl_SUITE).
   18: 
   19: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   20: 
   21: %% include the Merl header file
   22: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   23: 
   24: %% for assert macros
   25: -include_lib("eunit/include/eunit.hrl").
   26: 
   27: %% Test server specific exports
   28: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   29: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   30: 
   31: %% Test cases
   32: -export([merl_smoke_test/1,
   33:          transform_parse_error_test/1, otp_15291/1]).
   34: 
   35: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   36: 
   37: all() ->
   38:     [merl_smoke_test,
   39:      transform_parse_error_test,
   40:      otp_15291].
   41: 
   42: groups() -> 
   43:     [].
   44: 
   45: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   49:     ok.
   50: 
   51: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   52:     Config.
   53: 
   54: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: -define(tokens2str(X), ??X).
   58: 
   59: merl_smoke_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   60:     ?assertThrow({error, "1: syntax error before: '{'" ++ _},
   61:                  f(merl:quote("{"))),
   62:     ?assertEqual(tuple, erl_syntax:type(merl:term({}))),
   63:     ?assertEqual("{foo, 42}", f(merl:term({foo, 42}))),
   64:     ?assertEqual("f(X) -> {ok, X}.", f(?Q("f(X) -> {ok, X}."))),
   65:     ?assertEqual("{foo, 42}", f(?Q("{foo, 42}"))),
   66:     ?assertEqual("2 + 2", f(?Q("2 + 2"))),
   67:     ?assertEqual("%% comment preserved\n{foo, 42}",
   68:                  f(?Q(["%% comment preserved", "{foo, 42}"]))),
   69:     ?assertEqual("'@foo'", f(merl:tree(merl:template(?Q("'@foo'"))))),
   70:     ?assertEqual("42", f(merl:subst(?Q("_@foo"), [{foo, merl:term(42)}]))),
   71:     ?assertEqual({ok, []}, merl:match(?Q("foo"), ?Q("foo"))),
   72:     ?assertEqual(42, merl:switch(?Q("foo"), [fun () -> 42 end])),
   73:     ?assertEqual("{foo}", f(begin Foo = ?Q("foo"), ?Q("{_@Foo}") end)),
   74:     ?assertEqual("{foo}", f(begin Foo = foo, ?Q("{_@Foo@}") end)),
   75:     ?assertEqual("{[bar], baz()}",
   76:                  f(begin
   77:                        Tree = ?Q("{foo, [bar], baz()}"),
   78:                        ?Q("{foo, _@Bar, '@Baz'}") = Tree,
   79:                        ?Q("{_@Bar, _@Baz}")
   80:                    end)),
   81:     ?assertEqual("{[bar], baz()}",
   82:                  f(begin
   83:                        Tree = ?Q("{foo, [bar], baz()}"),
   84:                        case Tree of
   85:                            ?Q("{foo, _@Bar, '@Baz'}") -> ?Q("{_@Bar, _@Baz}")
   86:                        end
   87:                    end)),
   88:     ok.
   89: 
   90: transform_parse_error_test(_Config) ->
   91:     ?assertEqual("merl:quote(\"{\")",
   92:                  f(merl_transform:parse_transform(
   93:                      [?Q("merl:quote(\"{\")")], []))),
   94:     ?assertEqual("merl:quote(2, \"{\")",
   95:                  f(merl_transform:parse_transform(
   96:                      [?Q("merl:quote(2, \"{\")")], []))),
   97:     ?assertEqual("merl:qquote(\"{\", [{var, V}])",
   98:                  f(merl_transform:parse_transform(
   99:                      [?Q("merl:qquote(\"{\", [{var, V}])")], []))),
  100:     ?assertEqual("merl:qquote(2, \"{\", [{var, V}])",
  101:                  f(merl_transform:parse_transform(
  102:                      [?Q("merl:qquote(2, \"{\", [{var, V}])")], []))),
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: otp_15291(_Config) ->
  106:     C0 = merl:quote("() -> ok"),
  107:     A1 = erl_anno:new(1),
  108:     {clause,A1,[],[],[{atom,A1,ok}]} = C0,
  109:     C2 = merl:quote("(_,_) -> ok"),
  110:     {clause,A1,[{var,A1,'_'},{var,A1,'_'}],[],[{atom,A1,ok}]} = C2,
  111:     C1 = merl:quote("(_) -> ok"),
  112:     {clause,A1,[{var,A1,'_'}],[],[{atom,A1,ok}]} = C1,
  113:     ok.
  114: 
  115: %% utilities
  116: 
  117: f(Ts) when is_list(Ts) ->
  118:     lists:flatmap(fun erl_prettypr:format/1, Ts);
  119: f(T) ->
  120:     erl_prettypr:format(T).
